CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 15, 1956, pg. 2, reads: "Cephus' Checker Club Gives $$$ to NAACP - Wylie Avenue 'Samaritan' - Cephus Ford hammers open a safe to donate the contents to the Crippled Children's Fund, represented by Third Ward Constable Sidney Brunswasser [Brunwasser], left, and the NAACP, represented by center to right, its president, Rev. C. H. Foggie; treasurer, John Jones and executive secretary, Mrs. Marian [Marion] B. Jordon. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: J. Cephus Ford holding hammer, Constable Sidney Brunwasser, Rev. Charles Foggie, John Jones, and Marion Jordon, gathered around safe for benefit of the NAACP and Crippled Children's Fund

(Charles Herbert), 1912-2000.Jordon, Marion Bond.
